subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... No, that s why we have static typing. Besides, *you* have tests.  Not everybody does. If I have to choose between tests and tests and static typing , I
messageBody:
On 2/2/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
>
> > - Can break when refactoring
>
> That's why we have tests.


No, that's why we have static typing.

Besides, *you* have tests. Not everybody does.

If I have to choose between "tests" and "tests and static typing", I will
pick the latter any day.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
